website_summaries.verdict: Monster's Turbine in-ear headphone looks, feels, and sounds like a much more expensive model.
pros: Monster's Turbine in-ear headphone delivers excellent sound quality, with strong bass

customer_reviews.title: Apparently not made to last
customer_reviews.text: Sound was decent when they were working but one side will go dead first. The first pair died in less than a year and I had to pay shipping in order to obtain a replacement under warranty. The second pair also died in less than a year. It will not be easy for me to consider buying another pair when there are plenty of better alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: wrtboy

customer_reviews.title: Some good headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are some great headphones. They work well and have a decent bass for only ear buds. I have had one issue where the ear buds have separated but it is a simple fix with some glue. I even put these through the was on accident and they still worked! But these are quite dated compared to newer headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for something like 58 dollars during a Amazon Gold Box Deal. So far I am happy with them. At first I hated them and was ready to return, but after a day or so of getting used to them. I enjoy them. Try all the heads!!! I normally use the medium default size with ear buds. But this was not the case with these. The small tree shaped ones were perfect. Sound all depends on how they are fit in your ear. If its just a little loose. or a little the wrong way. They sound horrid. But there is this sweet spot that is amazing once you find it
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Williams

customer_reviews.title: You will NOT be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: From reading all the reviews, these seemed like good earbuds, but they are not. In my opinion, they are GREAT earbuds! Excellent fit (interchangable rubber tips make it easy), excellent sound quality -- what more do you need? these are quite the bargain. People who have listened through them are telling me they think they got ripped off paying $300 and more for their earbuds because miine actually sound just as good or BETTER! You can tell just from the packaging that Monster cares about quality through-and-through. They do offer pricier earbuds, but personally I am very pleased with these. What a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine N. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Good But Not Great
customer_reviews.text: Update: Go ahead and buy these if they are only $60! I paid $100 Ok...I like great sounding audio and while these headphones are a big step up from the standard Ipod headphones these don't meet my expectations for great sounding headphones. Don't get me wrong, I will be wearing these from now on but for close to $100 for headphones I was expecting a bit more. I don't get the spacial feeling that I read in all the previews and product information. I also think the bass is good but not great. They fit in my ears great though so I am happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sound good, but....
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound exceptional, however after just a few hours of continuous use, the left earbud cut out almost completely and it did not start to work again until I had left the headphones for a few hours. Went through 3 sets that had the exact same problems and ended up buying a cheaper pair of Klipch headphones (awesome sound) I used these earbuds with 320kbps files and they sound really great. Packaging was awesome and the overall experience with Amazon was great (considering I had to get 3 replacement sets) Too bad they didn't work for me...
customer_reviews.author: Dustyn F

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good sound but flimsy construction
customer_reviews.text: Ironically, considering that Monster made its name with ultra-thick audio cables, the big problem with these earbuds is the cheap construction of the cable & connector. These have VERY thin conductor wiring -- so much so that my model, at least, had a bad connection in the molded plug area. I have the turbine pro model, too, and I'm happy with them (admittedly, the cable there is also thinner than, say my shure E4Cs). I'd bought these for my daughter. The sound quality is not bad, though not great. We could have lived with that, if not for the construction problems. Going back.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but zero durability
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few pair for running and at work. They are horrible for running sweat killed the speakers. Now Monster sells running ear-speaker which are very good. Now I use the ear speakers for relaxation. If you pull the speakers out of your ear via the wire the wire separates from the speaker and the sound is killed. They sent me a new pair which I am gingerly taking care of however they are starting to separate. Great sound...durability sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and seperation
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on 'deal of the day" for $59.00! I had a friend that had them and was blown away. I knew then i needed them. It was great to see the sale come up on Amazon. The bass and the seperation of distinct sounds is as well as over the ear headphones! I listen to all different kinds of music from classical to barbershop chorus, and they all sound more rich, full of clarity and pure without distortion. The extra ear buds are great for all size ear canals. My kids love to use them too. Very sleek and professional looking packaging. And of course, it is a great value for the $$ i spent.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Sound good but experienced "driver flex"
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning these to Amazon. When inserting the right earbud, I heard crinkling, cracking, and popping noises - and an internet search revealed that this was caused by "driver flex" in cheaper closed in-ear earbud designs. I've had several Shure and Etymotic earbuds in the past and they never did this, but cheaper in-ear earbuds (Skullcandy, iMetal, etc) all did. For an earbud of this price, I would expect higher quality materials. They sounded good when I could get the right earbud working, but I do not want a cheap defective product.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Best I've had. Clear highs and deep bass.
customer_reviews.text: I've tested a bunch of ear buds including Sonys, Sennheisers and these are the best in ear buds I've listened to. Sound quality is simply amazing. Clarity as well as deep bass. They also come with a very unique style of tips which drill in your ear and fit very snug giving you the best sound possible from ear buds. I got these on prime when they were $80 and I highly recommend it. They are probably the best for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Moses

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap headphones = Cheez-Whiz. These headphones = Muester cheese. AMAZING quality, responsive bass levels that do not get muddy, mids were crisp and clean, highs were detailed and never got distorted. The quality of audio that came out of these things was above anything I've heard before out of earbuds, or since. The downside is the cables weren't exactly durable, and the wiring has become exposed in a few spots.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm very particular about sound and need clarity and depth or I am not satisfied. Well, I heard things in my music I never knew was there! Great treble, bass and everything in between. Make sure you read and follow the instructions on selecting the right rubber tip and on how to insert these in your ears. You may think it doesn't matter and that you already know but the fit makes all the difference to get the most out of these little gems. I've had a set of Bose Noise Cancelling headphones for years and I can't wait to try these on my next flight.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J. Marotta

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, excellent noise isolation
customer_reviews.text: These earphones sound great, bass is very good, overall frequency response is very good. To get the best sound reproduction they have to fit tightly in your ear, try wetting the rubber tip before inserting them. These earphonse are made of metal so they are kind of heavy, but so far that hasn't caused any problems. I'm wondering how they'd be for jogging or other physical activities. They came with two nice carrying cases, the extra can be used as a change purse. Overall an excellent product, and I've tried many earphones. The only thing I did not like was the wire is a bit short, maybe 2' in length.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy P.

customer_reviews.title: Best in-ear solution for the price
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best sounding in-ear headphones I've every used. Right out of the box, which was nicely appointed, they are full of bass. I suppose they'll get better after some break-in, but compared to the Etymotic EC3's I had previously (which I loved) these are light years ahead. Sonically they sound great with flat EQ. Great presence and soundstage, perfect isolation level. Pardon me, while I jam a bit...Manchester Orchestra-style. Longer review later, but for the <sixty bux I paid I am ENTIRELY SATISFIED.
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great (smells funnny?)
customer_reviews.text: The earphones are fabulous. I was alerted to a sale and so I got them at a great price. Sound fidelity, particularly bass, is superior to other earbud phones in the price range of the sales price. The only issue had nothing to do with the earphones themselves. The packaging came with a horrible chemical smell that I could only think is a form of insecticide. The smell permeated the packaging and the two pouches that are included with the earphones. I discarded the packaging and aired the pouches outside for a couple of days. That did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: These look, feel and sound like  much more expensive earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the gimmicky "In-ear speakers" tag but that's about all the bad things I have to say about these Earbuds. I got them while they were on sale for 60 and thought about selling them but decided to spoil myself a bit and I've never looked back. CNET ranks these as one of the five best earbuds and I couldn't agree more. unless you want to spend over 200 dollars on earbuds, these are the ones for you. As CNET puts it: The bottom line: Monster's Turbine in-ear headphone looks, feels, and sounds like a much more expensive model. Read more: [...].
customer_reviews.author: Virge

customer_reviews.title: Great noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Very solid quality construction. The metal casing makes them feel very substantial. The only downside being that the extra weight makes them slightly more prone to loosen/fall out if you're moving at all. The snug comfortable fit is nothing short of amazing at blocking out noise, which is especially nice because it allows you to listen at much softer volumes. All in all it's a great set of ear buds, and absolutely fantastic if you're in a noisy environment, or not moving a whole lot. This would be an ideal pair for airplane rides.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great...for about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my girlfriend. I, myself, prefer Klipsch but she gets what she wants. Great packaging and (deceptively) they appear to be very solid. The sound is almost comparable with the Klipsch S2 (more bass, but less crisp mids and highs) but not near the X10. My GF however, was happy with the style and performance .... for the approximately TWO MONTHS she used them before the left bud simply went out. When Monster claims that these earbuds are "built to last".... they left out the remainder of the sentence... "built to last -- two months".
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mcnulty

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great buds!
customer_reviews.text: I have Sennheiser's, Phillips, the new AKG's,Shure SE110 and Skullcandy Full Metals. I thought the AKG's were good until I saw a deal on the Monsters, the are really good. The only problem I had were the ear rubber plugs, they didn't keep out backround noise. I replaced them with the Comply 400's foam tips (from Amazon) for a perfect fit, they keep out all outside sound and are comfortable. The buds allow me to listen at a lower volume and still hear all the detail. I listen to mostly Jazz and Classical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mom approved
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my mom because she had always used the cheap ones that come with devices in the past. When she first tried these on, all she could say was wow over and over. They come with many different ear tips, so you can choose whichever is most comfortable for you. It has some of the best packaging I have seen for a small electronics item. The box it comes in feels like something you would not want to throw away. It feels like a high end product at a low end price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: For $75 its a steal!!
customer_reviews.text: The bass on these earphones is ridiculous! If you are not a music producer or engineer there is no need spending hundreds of dollars on expensive earphones this will definitely satisfy your ears! there is definitely much more detail on these compared to the Klipsch S4 i had before and much more bass! But it is crucial you get the right fit! Monster provides you with plenty of options in the box theses earphones come in so take your time and get a good fit!
customer_reviews.author: ARLW

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved these earphones. I used them on planes and off. Absolutely great. Until about a month ago (nearly 2 3/4 years after buying them) when one of the earpieces simply stopped working, replaced by intermittent loud static. There is no damage to the wires, or the earpiece or the rubbed ear insert, yet it simply doesn't work. Is there any kind of repair or replacement available for this product?
customer_reviews.author: Peter Yurowitz

customer_reviews.title: These were fantastic headphones that lasted me for about 4 years
customer_reviews.text: These were fantastic headphones that lasted me for about 4 years, until they met an untimely demise. Very good sound quality for in ear headphones, although I think there are other similar options available for a much lower price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Melluzzo

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones - Not best build quality
customer_reviews.text: The first set of headphones I received were defective. Also, the connector was straight and not a right-angle connector as indicated on the packaging. However, the new set I received as a replacement did have a right angle connector. I returned the first set as the right headphone was coming apart on arrival. Both pairs sounded great, but obviously a few problems with the first set. Luckily, Amazon's return policy was great as always.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bair

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong Sound.
customer_reviews.text: Strong bass, clean highs, handles high volume well. I use these when I commute back and fourth to work on a Harley Davidson. These are the only headphones that I have found that can overpower the wind and sound from the bike. It is important that you find the right ear buds to fit your ear right. But once you do, these things will rock for you.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Fretwell

customer_reviews.title: Quality Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a set of Shure E2's for years and there were getting a little worn so I decided to get these. The solid construction and quality materials are well worth the price if not more. I particularly loved all the different sized earbuds and cases that you get with the ear phones. The sound quality is excellent and the Bass response is the best out of any headphones I've ever purchased. Great buy, definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: The fit is everything!
customer_reviews.text: Like many here I was unimpressed when I first used them. Bass was lacking and overall sound quality was nothing impressive. Then I tried the small flange type earbuds and all I can say is these headphones are awesome. The sound stage and bass were exceptional. I hear more in my music than I ever did before. Get the right fit to get a good seal and the performance will blow you away. Very impressed and pleased with my purchase. Emko out.
customer_reviews.author: Emko San

customer_reviews.title: Read the Instructions
customer_reviews.text: The sound of the Monster Turbines is incredible. Best I've ever owned (I've had Sennheisers, Sony, Apple and others). Read the instructions that come in the box: the fit of each ear bud (left and right) in your ear canals is key to getting the vaunted bass sound you want from your earphones. The Monsters come with several different tips so that you can experiment to get the fit just right (I needed to use two different sizes). I'm hearing subtle production elements in different rock bands that I'd not heard before, even on floor speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Seagrave

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Came in its original Monster packaging, complete with plastic sealing. Clean, new, and the Voice Control works perfectly with my iPod Touch 4th Generation. I have had dealings with Monster before, and they have always gone above and beyond in customer service. The bass is excellent, I can hear the little subtleties in music (an accidental drop of a drumstick in the back of an orchestral, for example), and they've been very hardy.
customer_reviews.author: Echo

customer_reviews.title: Best in ear speakers
customer_reviews.text: The best in ear speakers I have ever used. I use these to meditate and they seal out all unwanted noise while giving high quality sound. They are awesome but that is not even the reason for the five stars. I fall asleep in these babies, been doing over a year now and they have not failed. All the others I have used failed in a few weeks but these are still going. There is not even a short in the cable. I would definitely recommend these for people who put their ear buds through the most rigorous treatment. I really wish they made over the ear speakers too.
customer_reviews.author: James Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Short Review
customer_reviews.text: OK couple of things: - I wish I could give 4.5 stars - I got these for $50 bucks here during some promotion - that was too good to pass - The are really VERY well built - Sound is great Only con for me is that they are a little bulky... I don't know if that makes sense.... they are a little heavy but then again super well built so you can look at it both ways. Anyway with the price I got.... these cannot be beat but I think the current price ($100 plus) is a little high.
customer_reviews.author: Bikram Dang

customer_reviews.title: What a DISSAPOINTMENT - Don't make the same mistake!!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the headphones functioned only a few times before sound would only stream through one headphone - possibly due to shotty workmanship or wireing. I requested a return of the product and refund - which was initially approved by their customer service. When the original plastic shrink wrap was not included in my shipment (even through I had cleared the contents with the company's agent), they would not authorize the full refund and neglected to repair or acknowledge the faulty performance of the headphones. Don't be taken in by these - the company DOES NOT stand by their product and will not work with customers who may unfortunately get a "lemon" headphone set! I will not buy from them again!
customer_reviews.author: H. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are really a great product. Some say they are a bit heavy but really how lazy are people these days? They seem just fine and once you wear them a few times you dont even notice. They sound quality it awesome and they deliver pretty good bass for and in ear headphone. I really like these headphones and if you are looking for something in this price range I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 months
customer_reviews.text: The dopest ear buds on the planet. When I let other people listen to them, their jaw(s) dropped every, single, time. Unforutnately, the left one quit working today. I've been pretty hard on them tho... Been through the washing machine about 10 times since I've owned them. Always leaving them in my pockets and s***. DOPE HEAD PHONES WHILE THEY LASTED. Arrrrgghhhh
customer_reviews.author: DonJohn87

customer_reviews.title: Nice while they lasted but they didn't last too long
customer_reviews.text: I used these primarily at work, just sitting at my desk listening to podcasts and music while programming. Light use, non-sport. And they broke 2 times. The first time, the left earbud split in two where it's assembled. I used some JBWeld to seal it back together and all was well. However recently, the earbuds have all but died, giving muted music. While they worked they sounded great and came at a fair price point of around $100 when I bought them through Amazon. 2 stars for that. Minus 3 stars for average quality and poor durability. $100 earbuds should not break after 3 years with light use.
customer_reviews.author: Occidentalist

customer_reviews.title: FAKE!
customer_reviews.text: I sent mine back to Amazon for a full refund (which I was granted) because these are fake ear buds. They look the same and have the same name and awesome box but they sound very tinny (bad quality) and didn't feel right in the ear, don't but this product as it is a knockoff trying to get people to buy this and think they bought the real ones when they purchased a hunk of plastic from china.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Pells

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional bass quality, the best ear buds I have had.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Shure, Etymotic, JBuds ear buds. These, by far, are the better sounding, deeper bass, not as bright treble (which is good from my point of view) ear phones. It take a little time to find the proper fitting for your comfort, but it is a very worthwhile process. I tried with different types of music to get the best sound for my taste. They are a bit heavy, and the wire feels thin, so I can't speak about durability. Time will tell. Given that I had got a great deal on these ($58 I think), I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roytman

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a great price on a lightning deal. They sound great and I can seal out the sounds of the DC Metro and co-workers who talk to loud. The sound quality is really nice and they have the right amount of Bass. I've had the Etymotic 6i's which had great sound on the highs and mid-range but little to no bass. These Monster Turbines are far better and sturdier. They came with a nice selection of ear pieces to get a custom fit. The packaging is really nice too.
customer_reviews.author: The Big L

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I use earbud speakers when riding my motorcycle so quality and sound isolation are very important. Haven't used these on my bike yet (It's December in Illinois) but the sound is incredibly different from the cheaper ones I was using. Sound is louder (I compared them)which should be a HUGE improvement. And the Bass is much more noticeable. Wish now I had bought two pair (they were on sale)!!
customer_reviews.author: User54

customer_reviews.title: Even better than my Bose earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through numerous earbuds trying to find that nice balance of performance and price. These have all of the sound quality I get from my bose, but are far more comfortable and stay in place without any fuss. I can pick up things out of the music that I could never get from my stock ipod buds or the skull candy earbuds I tried. After trying these, I'll buy another pair if these die.
customer_reviews.author: Lrritchie

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: At first they do sound muddy or muffled, but after burn-in (I did 100 hours), they sound perfect, amazing, any adjective that is positive. I always use them. EDIT: After 2 years, these had the common problem where the plug bends over time and eventually you have to hold it in a perfect position for the earbuds to work correctly. I don't handle my electronics roughly either. I wish they lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Must have aligned perfectly
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, not worth the money. I'm getting more hiss and less bass then with the el cheapo set I replaced, Also, you have to go through a series of odd twists and contortions to get them lined up pefectly in the ear, otherwise you get about half of the sound. This is a real pain if you re trying to use them sompleace where you might have to remove them regularly, suc as at the office.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Lach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones on sale for about $100, and they are worth every dollar. These are the best headphones that I have ever used except for my room mates pair of UM2s. If you do not want to spend $250 on a pair of, then I would definitely say that you should buy some Monster Turbines. They have perfectly clear flat EQ audio as opposed to the Beats By Dre that have obnoxiously high base. Monster headphones ROCK!
customer_reviews.author: zecon

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, especially low frequencies - you get awesome basses from those guys. Only problem is difficult to keep them in the ear if you are doing moderate or higher level of activities. They are quite heavy, especially compared to others in same category, and have no way of fixing them in the ear. Would definitely recommend for stationary use, or maximum while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, excellent seller!
customer_reviews.text: My headphones were shipped the same day I placed my order and they arrived a couple days BEFORE the estimate! When I opened the box they were in pristine condition and in all original packaging. They sound amazing and I continue to use them daily months later and so far there had been no degradation in the quality of function. I would highly recommend this seller to anyone in the market to purchase a pair of headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Mojokick

customer_reviews.title: Colorful sound but heavy build is a minor factor
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound but the build of the IEM is way too heavy, its a struggle to be kept on. Wires are too thin and easily messed up. Sound was way awesome compared to the UM1, Brainwavz M2 and some other IEMS that I had compared it with. Music that I am normally associated with are pop, rock, jazz. Instrumental pieces sounded way too colorful and heavy for audiophiles who appreciate the respective layers of each piece of song. Overall a bargain piece of product at just $99, way too good to be true. Would be looking forward to the higher end models =)
customer_reviews.author: xavier low

customer_reviews.title: canceLT he first review
customer_reviews.text: MY PRIOR REVIEW OF MONSTER TURBINES SHOULD BE DISREGARDED. THEY MADE A REASONABLE CONCESSION TO ME AND I AM CONTENT. THE EARPHONES THEMSELVES WERE WORTH THE WAIT. THEY WERE ORIGINALLY A GIFT BUT I HAVE DECIDED TO KEEP THEM. WE GAVE ANOTHER GIFT TO MY WIFE'S FRIEND. THE SOUND IS AS GOOD AS ANY HEAD OR EAR PHONES I HAVE TRIED. I AM NOT AN AUDIOPHILE BUT I HAVE BEEN LISTENING TO PHONES FOR TWENTY YEARS AND THESE ARE THE BEST I HAVE HEARD. I READ SOME OF THE POOR REVIEWS AND AM MYSTIFIED. THESE TURBINES ARE INCREDIBLE AND THEY WERE REFURBISHED. DO NOT HESITATE TO PURCHASE THEM.
customer_reviews.author: R. Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer put it: "I have eclectic and diverse tastes in music". I would imagine the 4-5 hundred dollar set sounds awesome, but for the money these things are amazing. I have a $300 set of headphones and the monster turbines compare quite well. If your looking for "Bang for your buck" really good ear phones, then these will do the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: W. Chase

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty sick  but the cable is a little short
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound very spacious and detailed. They seem well built and robust. The cable is a little on the short side but Im not complaining at least it means less to have hanging out to get caught on things or tangled. I got these on a deal of the day special at 58 bucks Not sure if I could justify paying the full price but if they ever broke Id be very very sad
customer_reviews.author: E. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome headphones, though they don't deserve such a high price tag, bought them on a gold box deal for 60 odd dollars and its 60$ well spent. Choosing the right ear piece would make a lot of difference to the sound quality and also the blocking of the outside sound. only bad thing I found is the you can hear the sound of the cable touching you whenever you walk, not preferable for running as the headphones are quite heavy and might fall off... would recommend only if you find a good deal, but its not worth 150 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Tudelu

customer_reviews.title: Beats.... BEATS EarBuds! Hands Down A Hidden Contender !
customer_reviews.text: Best earbuds on the market for the price. Way better than beats! Quality of build, surpasses that of BEATS!
customer_reviews.author: jordan stamper

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I got these when they were on sale for $60.00 and I will say they were worth every penny of that money. Very solid SQ build quality feels good thick cords, the buds have weight to them. I cant say enough good things about these buds. I hold judgment on these buds on durability as I have not used them enough to say if they will hold up, also customer service is unknown as I have not needed to use them on these buds, but as it stands now I have one word to say Wow.
customer_reviews.author: TyShawn

customer_reviews.title: Don't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I have bought my wife two of these in ear speakers and within 7months they have broken. She is not hard on things and I bought the second pair because they seem to be the only ones that fit in her ears and stay in. The second pair gave out after about 6 months or less I am not sure exactly how long it was. I would not recommend unless you like buying replacements often.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kohen

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, but too heavy for running
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of Shure E2C's that lasted 3 years of heavy use (half marathons). I also bought the Shure SE210's for essentially the same price ($100). The Monster's sound better but are very heavy and tend to slide out of the ear canal when running. The SE210's fall between the E2C and Monster's in sound quality; they are very comfortable and secure when running. I kept both: Monsters for commuting, Shures for running.
customer_reviews.author: running fool

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The sounded is awesome till one of the ears just stopped working
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I received these about a week ago. The first time I listened to them I was just blown away by the detail in the music. The imaging is perfect and the mids are reproduced spot on. The bass is solid and clean and the highs are good as well. One thing I did was to put the Comply foam tips on as I really prefer those over the silicone ones.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Baker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this together with the ten dollar V-Moda and at first, I was disappointed. It sounds pretty good but hardly any bass. But as I keep using it, it keeps getting better and now I think it's worth the money. The sound is crisp and the bass is what it should be. Not a very good noise cancelling feature but good enough for my purpose. I bought this because I don't like listening to people screaming on their cell phone. It works. The leads are rubberized so it does not kink or or get tangled up. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B. Monzon

customer_reviews.title: My First High Quality Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These Monster Turbines are the first high quality headphones I have invested in, and so far it was worth every penny. I was a huge skeptic, because I have had so many headphones break in the past that I couldn't see the point in spending so much money on them. I really love these Monsters they are enabling me to appreciate music again for the first time in ages. Now they just have to stand up to the test of time and heavy usage. I'll keep you updated.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.83706

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Earphones!
customer_reviews.text: I loved these earphones, and great while mowing the grass! I lost them in the yard, and have yet found them! I was caught up in some trees close to our edging when they caught a bush and flung somewhere! I would buy again, even at the higher price! Great sound, and better than bose!
customer_reviews.author: J. Dedeker

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding ear buds!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price! These ear buds moved me to write my first Amazon review. I am 47 years old and love listening to high quality sounding rock music and I wish I would have tried Monster ear buds sooner. They have accurate strong punchy bass, very detailed mid range and vocals and a respectable top end, great separation and decent sound stage. Best ear bud I have heard for rock music without breaking the bank. Monster won me over with this product, they bring life back to flat sounding digital music! They also are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Toolman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding in ear speakers! Very marginal distortion at high volume and the bass is deep (when properly in your ear). Only issue is that they tend to fall out when moving around, or if you use the ear holders you can still lose that tight fit. Not recommended for working out with these on. Also take quite a bit of 'burn in' for them to sound top notch. I guess about 3 days of everyday listening.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Jsupra

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Had this turbine headphone for few years now. I have only positive things to say. Great sound, great bass, great noise sealing, I am 100% satisfied with this headphones and the performance they have. Better than any Bose I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: LV

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Decent with good bass.
customer_reviews.text: Have already used them for almost 2.5 years and still doing good. Headphones are durable and sound is good quality. Bass is nice as well. Its nice to see that the headphones did not wear off. Update, Aug 08 2015: Still no signs of wear and tear, still going great, with awesome bass. I have used it in rain, at gym and at many outdoor places. I am glad to see that this product is not only durable, but is also great sounding.
customer_reviews.author: Krona

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are probably the best I have ever owed. I recommend Monster Turbines, the bass is exceptional! These headphones are also long lasting, dropped them in the water and it still works like the first day!:D Shipping was also fast, came the next day without buying one day shipping! I'll be buying Monster products more often from now on. They sound just as good as major brands such as Sennheiser, Bose, and Audio Technica.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: These sound fantastic. Great bass without sacrificing highs and mids. For in-ear speakers that are made of metal, they are surprisingly comfortable with the right ear tip. If you get these, you should also get the Monster Super Tips, which are sold separately. I was able to find the perfect fit with a medium foam tip. The only complaint I have with these is the cord is prone to tangle. Other than that, they are great and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: rgtute

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Don't just don't. Bass quality depends on how aggressive you're willing to be in pushing the monsters into your ears. My pair fell apart after two months; left side just quit and I had to take it to a repair guy who said "well these are not very well built are they?" As far as I noticed amazon actually took them off the site for a while - probably due to too many complaints - now it's back and it's still bad for you. Or me.
customer_reviews.author: FranklyMyDear

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones when they were on sale for 59 dollars. Can't really get a deal better than that. Best headphones I've ever used. The bass hits so hard, its like a sub woofer in my ear. Way better than over the ear headphones that give no bass. Much more portable also. Even without the sale, these headphones are wroth the money if you care about music, especially electronic and hiphop.
customer_reviews.author: Laudate Dominum

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING SOUNDING HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: These Headphones ARE AMAZING!!! I listened to one of the songs I play when I get knew headphones or speakers, a song I have heard hundreds of times by the way, and I heard new things on it. I use them for motivation to work out. these HeadSpeakers are one of my best investments in a while. The bass is really booming, great mids and treble. I used to have the Altec Lansing UHP106 Backbeat which are $30 at best buy. until I got the Monster Turbines the Altec lansing ones were the best I had owned. The Turbines Blow them away. No pun intended.
customer_reviews.author: JJP4689

customer_reviews.title: Good, Not Great
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good. It's not worth the MSRP but I can thank Amazon for a great price. I like headphones with strong bass (yes I listen to a lot of hip hop and rap) and these just don't give me enough even with a good seal. I prefer my wife's Solo HD's, but then again, she paid 3 times the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: why?
customer_reviews.text: outside of an issue with the earbud separating where the two halves of the metal ends meet in the middle, and finding the correct earplugs, once I crazy glued them back together and found the right fit, the sound from these things was stellar. Handles distortion free thumping bass with ease. Anyone having issue with the sound either received the occasional mistake in a product, or may need to concentrate on rating the poor ability of their ears to hear. I've had these for quite some time now, and they're a great purchase and a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Henke

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade from cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very good sounding upgrades from the cheap crap you buy for 5 to 40 buck range. I bought these as a present to my teenager son who as he got older appreciated better sound quality and could take care of a headset better than when he was younger. Nice set overall.
customer_reviews.author: E. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: GOOD ...BUT
customer_reviews.text: like the headphones, neither case provided works very well, the headphones are difficult to get in but do fit, it may just take you a couple of tries to figure out how best works for you. they are a little heavy. the metal design is nice but a little weighty. haven't worn them for a long period yet but it doesn't bother me DO NOT BE FOOLED there is no in line pause button (the picture shows there is a play pause button on the headphones this is not true) everything else is good!
customer_reviews.author: Owner

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Decent
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound Needs a few more rubber ear piece sizes A mic would be nice, or maybe I missed a different model The base is decent, mids are fine, and the highs are not too tinny - overall god product. Probably compares with most $40-$70 buds
customer_reviews.author: Stuart P.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had numerous headphones which i use to go running with. These are by far the best set, sound quality and fit wise, i have EVER had. I would recommend these to anyone who wants to listen to good sounds with a comfortable fit. Plus they come with plenty of extra ear pieces in case the default buds dont fit your ears. 10000% satisfaction!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scubasteve

customer_reviews.title: Great product, sounds awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great product, sounds awesome. Tends to emphasize bass frequencies, so don't buy them if you aren't into that. Super durable for earbuds - I heavily abused these guys for over a year before the cord frayed.
customer_reviews.author: Detes

customer_reviews.title: monster in-ear speakers
customer_reviews.text: These ear speakers are off the chain! They live up to their name in that it is like having a speaker in your ear. Love the variety of ear pieces they send so you can get the perfect fit for your ear. And the package they were sent in was simply elegant. Only small drawback is the bass could be a little fuller but other than that was definitely a worthwhile investment that I am sure to enjoy for some time. If the cheaper version of these earphones sound as great as they do, wonder what the more expensive ones sound like???
customer_reviews.author: CCG

customer_reviews.title: Loved the sound, but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: The sound was great, but the headphones started to separate right near the blue and red lines (the lines distinguishing left from right). Also, the cord connection started to fail near the headphone. I did use them for about 3 hours each day for a few months though...and while they lasted they had great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Simply the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: i did much research before i bought these but without a doubt they we're the best , especially for the price ... The Monster Turbine High-Performance In-Ear Speakers are what they claim to be " In ear speakers ". PROS: Price bass quality weight noise isolation (with right tips) CONS: i didn't buy them sooner I've had them for about 2 months and they are like brand new but i recently bought the Turbine(tm) Pro Gold Audiophile In-Ear Speakers(tm) i have to say that the gold are better but i recommend these more for the price ... hopefully this review can help you buy them ..the're worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Jairo Y. De Samaniego

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason why they call these speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when they were under the gold box deal and all I have to say is WHAT A DEAL! I never thought I would spend 60 dollars on headphones, but I'm a sucker for deals and so I thought I'd give these a try. They pack a lot of bass and the ear tips work really well in isolating noise. I usually use these when I work out and found that they would sometimes become loose in my ear, which gets annoying to push them back in my ear but the sound quality is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: sexynojutsu

customer_reviews.title: Great little phones
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these and lost them on a trip. Upset about spending another $100-150 I sought other options. Found a factory refurbished pair on Monster's website for $45. This is a STEAL for the quality of sound produced. They compare favorably to my $200 Sennheiser cans. Buy 'em. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: J Ratchford

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, very poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these earbuds this past December. I was very pleased with the sound quality- clear, deep bass and good overall balance. I was using them at my computer and walking to work. Last week, I was taking them out of my ears in a very standard fashion, and the right earbud broke into two pieces, leaving the wire hanging out. Naturally, I was surprised. With a price tag like this and a brand name like Monster, I expected more. I contacted Monster's customer support via email 5 days ago outlining the problem, and have yet to receive a response. Needless to say I am hesitant to recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: showell215

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: i got these puppys when they were on sale, i got em a day before i went on a plane, as everyone knows all you hear is the engine when you on a plane so i thought these would do nice. They did better than just nice, theyre perfect, no sound in no sound out, when i play them full blast they hurt my ears, if your looking for some good headphone you seriously cant go wrong with these. BUY EM
customer_reviews.author: Cody Pulliam

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Rich sound!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am really pleased with these ear buds. I got them on a cyber deal for 56 bucks. Once I found an ear tip that fit right the bass and richness of the reproduction just opened up!!! I also own a pair of Klipsch and sensenhizer buds and these are every bit as good. For me it's all about the fit and seal. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Cina

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones for myself about 2 months ago or so. I was very impressed with the construction and how solid they feel. came with a ton of extra inserts so fit virtually everyones ears. Then I put them on.. and wow. the sound was amazing. unfortunately after about a month the right bud lost the bass. it still puts out the highs great but must have had some sort of defect. called customer service and even though it was 20 minutes until they closed on a friday.. after 5 quick minutes on hold.. all of my needs were taken care of and I got a replacement pair on the way. Great experience overall.
customer_reviews.author: B$

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Quality is lacking
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great. Super clear and crisp, with good separation and frequency range. They are aptly named "in-ear speakers". They deserve that title. But they are poorly constructed. Right ear started cutting out after only one month of moderate usage. Judging from the other reviews in the 1 and 2 start categories here, it's obviously a chronic problem and makes these headphones ones to be avoided. It's really too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Presley Acuna

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I found these to sound kind of dull. I gave them like a dozen hours of burn-in, and maybe that wasn't enough. They sound sophisticated, but not in a way I liked. Too bad, because they are the most comfortable in-ear phones I've had.
customer_reviews.author: S. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my desk at work about a year ago. Initially my computer couldn't power them properly so I also bought an ASUS sound card and the combination is awesome. I can drown out even the most obnoxious people around me and the sound is still perfectly clear.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Redler

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on sale, waited a while to write a review to see how they held up. So far, so good. The build quality seems very good, cheaper headphones I've owned always break at the input end but these have been holding up to everyday use. The buds themselves feel a bit heavier than what I'm used to but I adjusted quickly to them. I prefer the standard ear tips compared to the deep cone shaped ones(which made the insides of my ears itch) and having two sets of the standard ones is something I really appreciated. Compared to some more expensive earbuds, I think these will hold up well compared to them.
customer_reviews.author: averageuser

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound over a short lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a very reasonable sale price and found them to have solid bass and reasonable overall sound quality for the price I paid ($58.99). I used them as a set of stationary listening headphones for my desk at work. After about a year of use I had to have them replaced under warranty only to have the second set fail just out of warranty. Based on the failures and the fact that the current price is significantly higher than what I paid I can't recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: clreedy21

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Pricey . . . And Well Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for listening while riding my motorcycle . . . They work great! They have strong enough bass to deliver great sound at 60 or 70 MPH . . . even with a half helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and underpowered in comparison to others...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a few months ago thinking they would be a sound improvement over my Klipsch pair (see other reviews), but found they are way too heavy (physically)in the ear and do not have sound quality as good as the Klipsch. Shipped them back to Amazon after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: joelpelley

customer_reviews.title: They actually FIT !!
customer_reviews.text: It seems I have owned dozens of "ear-buds"....and they always hurt my right ear after 30 mins or so. These "ear-speakers" sound amazing and come with 2 different styles of inserts...and each of these in different sizes. I was able to try on various inserts, one ear at a time and pick the best fit...for each ear canal. I happen to be most comfortable with a mismatched set...in size and style but it really works !! They are truly tangle-free and of excellent quality; come with a spiffy carrying case so they are always safe and handy. I love my Monster Turbines.
customer_reviews.author: k.aren

customer_reviews.title: The best for the price
customer_reviews.text: This headphones give me a very good experience, the audio is perfect, I am not a professional user but for the casual users this ear bunds give an unique experience, the only matter that I have is the weight, so heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Arturo Meza Marin

customer_reviews.title: Monster Turbines. Awesome Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I've just received my Monster Turbines that I've bought. There's a few things that I would like to share from my purchase. 1) Customer Service was great. Initially I thought I had problems with my shipping as I live outside USA. So I contacted Amazon and they were friendly in assisting me 2) Packaging was firm, and solid. 3) Shipment came in 1 week before estimated. ( Very elated ) 4) Have tested the Monster Turbines, Sound quality is excellent, so is the bass. I'll test it out a few more days, to confirm on it's durability as posted by other reviewers, and I'll post another review.
customer_reviews.author: Chel

customer_reviews.title: Most reliable headphone i've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for about 1 year now and so far the sound had stayed consistant and it sounds amazing. the only problem i've experienced is the fact that the cable looks all weird and bent, but other then that the connections are extremly reliable. I've tried these in an airplane and i have to say that the tips cancel noise very nicely and if loud music is your thing, these are very satisfying. The overall headset is good for daily music to in-plane music.
customer_reviews.author: KC890

customer_reviews.title: Best in ears for the money
customer_reviews.text: I seemed to have found the best in ear buds for the money. They sound great. Bass response is perfect and not too punchy. The cord has a nice rubberized feel and the speaker cases are sturdy metal. I use them with my Zune HD. Just watched Terminator Salvation on the Zune and they sound like sitting in the movie theater. I know Monster can be gimmicky with other products but they really did their homework on these.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after two months of very gentle use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these last year at Christmas time in a Gold box special for $70.00. Less than two months later one of the ear buds separated, rendering it useless. That's a lot of money to throw away. As to the sound it was OK, but not great. The bass on my Sennheiser CX-300 II Precision Enhanced Bass Earbuds is superior and they have held together very well. I would not recommend these and seeing another Monster Gold Box special today with poor customer reviews reminded me to speak out about the inferior workmanship of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Avowed Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Look Great Sound Superb
customer_reviews.text: Monster has got it right on the money with this one, there ear buds give u a high end headphones experince, now if monster could make a sweatproof gym version or a swimming version that could make them an extra billion, hopefully one of the product guys will read my comment and do that, iam going to buy more of there products just because these ear buds have amazed me.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: awesome in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: These in-ear headphones are awesome.. awesome bass and I use it everywhere I go, gym, running, basically goes with me. I had a Sony $200 in-ear headphone but the sound quality/base and blocking out external noise is none compared to this monster turbine high-performance in-ear speakers. It has an ear attachment for jogging/gym etc so it doens not fall off. Highly recommended never had a problem with it since I had it. I walked in the rain with it in my ear and it works well. Will be looking at buying another or the next version up.
customer_reviews.author: rockwoof

product_meta.title: Monster MH TRB IE High-Performance in-Ear Speakers, Black
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingWhat Critics Are Saying About Monster Turbine 

>  "Looks like Monster is doing more than just diversifying itself: It is serious about being a player in the headphone market." --David Worthington, Technologizer "We got a chance to try them out for ourselves and they are indeed very powerful and with an amazing amount of clarity for in-ear headphones...from the time we've spent so far with them - they're worth every penny." --Helena Stone, Chip Chick "Monster's Turbine in-ear headphone delivers excellent sound quality, with strong bass; robust, all metal construction; handsome carry case." --Steve Guttenberg, CNET.com "Monster hit their mark with the Turbines and listeners, both casual and discerning, will be satisfied with both their quality and value." --Sal Cangeloso, Geek.com "All in all, the Turbines are a nice entry into the in-ear headphone arena by Monster, and fantastic sound quality for the price—just make sure your music lives up to their high standards." --Benny Goldman, Gizmodo.com "…big sound, good bass, and comfort that you’d expect from full size high-end speakers." --Richard M. Sherwin, ElectronicHouse.com "How do they sound? In a word, fantastic." --Aric Annear, End User "At last, killer ear buds!" --Tommy Shaw, Styx "When paired with any of my portable devices (or non-portable ones for that matter) the Turbines sounded great. As promised, they deliver better bass than almost any other product at the price level, balanced out by solid mids and pretty clear highs. If volume is an issue for you, don’t worry, the Turbines can get quite loud without distortion, a feat that many in-ear headphones cannot accomplish." --- Sal Cangeloso, geek.com"... let’s do talk about sound. It’s stellar. Monster calls these “in-ear speakers” instead of “in-ear headphones” because they feel the sound is that good, and it’s not far from that. The audio is clear and full with impressive (but not muddy) bass for both music and games; sometimes annoyingly so, but that’s my own fault. Remember when you thought a 128 kbps bit rate was fine for your MP3s? You’re going to be paying for that with these headphones, because you’ll definitely hear all of the imperfections. It’s a fair trade-off, though, because you’ll also hear bits of your music that are lost on cheaper headphones."- Kirk Hiner, appletell.comThe Turbine Pros are surely the best ear-bud-type headphones I've heard and ones I could be happy with for years to come. The Turbines are stylish, perform strongly across the board, are comfortable and built to last.- Todd Whitesel, Audio Video Revolution


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Life is Too Short to Listen to Bad Headphones. These days, we spend a lot of time listening to music with headphones. Every minute you spend enjoying your music should be the best it can be, but ordinary headphones can't deliver the rich dynamics, full range, and emotional impact of your favorite music.Sound So Incredible, We Had to Call Them In-Ear Speakers Monster Turbines truly deliver the big sound, power, and clarity that you'd expect from full size high-end speakers. That's why we had to call them speakers, not headphones.Bass So Deep, it Sounds Like There's a Subwoofer Unlike other headphones that can't reproduce deep bass, Monster Turbines accurately reproduce even the lowest bass notes without distortion. You'll hear thunderous low-end for incredible sound with every kind of music,from the thumping bass beats of hip hop tracks to the deepest pipe organ notes in classical compositions. Less Noise, More Music. We live in a noisy world that can interfere with your listening. Monster Turbines include multiple sound isolating ear-tips to give you a perfect fit that seals out unwanted noise for a pure listening experience.Secure, Comfortable Fit for Active Lifestyles In-ear headphones give you total freedom to move for life on-the-go. But they don't always stay where they are or even in your ear, especially if you're working out. Monster's ear hooks keep your headphones firmly in place. They're lightweight, easy to wear and remove, and easily bend to fit your ear's shape.
feature_bullets: Low mass, wide bandwidth driver for precision response
Black chrome all-metal housing eliminates vibration for pure sound
Monster sound isolating eartips in multiple sizes provide a perfect fit to seal out noise
MicroStrand cable for extended frequency response

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars729 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
